page.title: 04 LOOKING AT PEOPLE
page.content: After the 1981 census it was found that, in the Kingstanding area,{65%}of the people were{over 65 years of age.} It was decided then, that any council houses which became empty in the area would be given to families with at least three children, so since then there have been more children moving into the district. At the{local {library}many events are held for them. Those under five go with their mums for storytime. Mums get a cup of coffee and the children have squash. Older children go to other events as well. For the school summer break, cookery, a fancy dress competition, a dog show and a dried prune-eating contest are planned.For old people there are many large-print books, coffee mornings and a home-delivery service.
